title: Auckland Airport is shut down as bomb squad is called in
text:
Officials at Auckland airport were forced to suspend flights and evacuate staff in nearby buildings this morning as police responded to a potential bomb threat.

Police were called to the airport on Monday morning to investigate the scare.

Flight paths were cleared by 9.15am local time but passengers have been warned to expect delays in and around the airport.

Road closures are still in place at Laurence Stevens Dr and Geoffrey Roberts Rd heading toward the domestic terminal.

Incoming planes were forced to circle above the airport while police determined the security threat.

Officials at Auckland airport were forced to suspend flights and evacuate staff in nearby buildings this morning as police responded to a potential bomb threat

A spokesperson from the NZ Defence Force told the NZ Herald a bomb squad had been called in to assist police.

'The New Zealand Defence Force can confirm that the NZDF Explosive Ordnance Disposal team has responded to a request for assistance from New Zealand Police at Auckland airport. No further details will be released.'

They were first spotted at 8am.

Auckland Airport released a statement letting passengers know all domestic and international flights have since resumed.

'Earlier this morning New Zealand Police suspended all flights to ensure the safety and security of everyone on Auckland Airport’s precinct.

'Some buildings have been evacuated.

'We ask that all workers and members of the public avoid the area until further notice.'

More to come.
